conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and distance information.
Initial conditions: pedestrian is 36 meters away, runs at constant speed, bus starts with uniform acceleration.
Pedestrian's speed is constant at 8 m/s; bus's speed increases uniformly from 0 to 8 m/s.
Time for pedestrian to catch up equals time for bus to accelerate from 0 to 8 m/s.
Calculate time for bus to accelerate using \( v = u + at \).
Time for pedestrian to catch up is 1 second.
Calculate distance pedestrian covers in 1 second: 8 m.
Pedestrian covers 44 meters in 1 second, considering initial distance.
Pedestrian will catch up to the bus when it covers the same distance as the bus.
Pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
